text: hello and welcome to community chats i'm
your host ali hama and today we're back
with lucy wang
a solution architect as part of our aws
grad program
luce you're here today to share with
students the launch of a very exciting
aws early careers innovation program
so can you start by telling our audience
a little bit about this program and what
students will be doing as part of it
hey ali thanks for having me here today
so the aws early careers innovation
program
is an eight-week developmental program
here at aws
for tertiary education students looking
to learn more about the cloud
and careers at aws the program
incorporates a mix of hands-on workshops
webinars and fireside chats to help
students build career ready skills
and explore possible career paths within
aws and the cloud industry
students will also work in teams on a
case competition
based on a mock customer scenario and
winners of the case competition will
have a chance to be fast-tracked in the
application process
for the fy 2022 to 2023 internship and
graduate intake
the program is fully virtual and weekly
sessions will be held every tuesday
from 6 to 7 30 pm australian eastern
standard time
this is the first time we're running the
program and we're looking to accept
around 100 students into the cohort
so it's a great opportunity for
participants to meet others who are also
interested in tech
and early in their career wow that
sounds like an amazing program for
students who are interested in tech and
you know just want to learn a little bit
more about what it's like working at aws
so loose what i want to know is who can
actually apply for the program and do
they actually need to come from a highly
technical background
so in terms of who can apply to the
program we require applicants to be
in their penultimate or pre-penultimate
year and are currently based in the
australia and new zealand region
but students definitely don't need to
come from a technical background to
apply
because the program doesn't have a very
big focus on technical skills
it's more geared towards helping
students develop soft skills and learn
more about the aws interview process and
what it's like to work at aws
thanks for clarifying lewis so for
students who want to find out a little
bit more about this program where can i
get more information and how can they
actually apply
yeah so if this program sounds
interesting to you or if you know
someone who might be interested in it
please click the link in the description
below to find out more about it
students can also apply by submitting
their details
through the application form and
answering two written response questions
applications close on the 2nd of august
and the program starts on the 10th of
august but spots are limited so i would
recommend students apply as soon as they
can to have the best chance of being
accepted into the program
wow that is sooner than i thought so
thank you so much luce for coming on the
show today and for
any students who are interested in
applying for the program please make
sure you head down to the link in the
description box below
and press supply so thank you so much
luce see you next time
thanks ali bye
